summary: hepatitis C virus (HCV) is a small, enveloped positive-sense RNA virus of the Flaviviridae family (Hepacivirus genus) since its discovery in 1989, HCV has been revealed as a primary cause of chronic hepatitis, end-stage cirrhosis, and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) worldwide, an estimated 200 million persons (approximately 3% of the global population) are chronically infected many miRNAs regulate a wide range of biological processes, including development [10], cell differentiation [11], proliferation, and apoptosis [12]–[14]. miR-21 was found to be more strongly expressed in HCC specimens than in non-tumorous tissues [23], and participates in HCC development by regulating the phosphatase and tensin homolog deleted on chromosome ten (PTEN) gene. miR-21 is upregulated upon RNA virus infection and acts as a negative regulator of type I IFN signaling. the mechanism involved in the regulation of miR-21 by HCV infection is still unknown. a random non-HCV-related miRNA (miR-93) was analyzed after HCV infection. human hepatocytes were infected with or without HCV for 12 h. expression of miR-21 was determined by qPCR. results are standardized to 1 in uninfected cells. the NS3/4A complex and NS5A protein exert the most stimulatory effects on the activation of the miR-21 promoter. qPCR analysis also showed that the NS3/4A complex and NS5A protein can enhance the expression of miR-21. the phosphorylation and total protein levels of c-Jun and c-Fos were determined by Western blot. all experiments were repeated at least three times with similar results. AP-1 elements in miPPR-21 are crucial for NS5A and NS3/4A inducibility. mutations in the binding sites (f11–f14) in miPPR-21 showed no significant effects. c-Jun and c-Fos were activated by NS5A in a time-dependent fashion. NS5A and NS3/4A proteins of HCV stimulate miR-21 expression through AP-1. but NS5A regulates miR-21 mainly through c-Jun and NS3/4A mediates miR-21 mainly through c-Fos. kinases regulate transcription factors that are important in regulation of AP-1 activation and expression. the results from luciferase activity assays showed that the miR-21 promoter activity induced by NS5A decreased significantly in the presence of SP600125 and GF10203. also, the miR-21 promoter activity up-regulated by NS3/4A was clearly repressed by U0126, PD98059, and GF10203. miR-21 expression was measured by qPCR (lower panel) cells were co-transfected with miPPR21 and dominant-negative mutants of ERK1 (mERK1), ERK2 (mERK2), JNK (mJNK) or control vectors at different concentrations. the role of ERK and JNK in the NS5A- and NS3/4A-mediated activation of miR-21 was further examined. the levels of phosphorylated JNK or phosphorylated ERK1/2 increased in a time-dependent fashion in the presence of NS5A or NS3/4A protein (Figure 4E) the levels of ERK1/2 phosphorylation was significantly reduced by PD98059, U0126, and GF109203. the phosphorylation and total protein levels of c-Jun (C) and c-Fos (G) were determined by Western blot (upper panel), and miR-21 expression was measured by qPCR (lower paned) all experiments were repeated at least three times with similar results. the PKC family has been shown to be involved in signal transduction associated with a wide range of biological responses.
